description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Guernsey updates - BBC News
maintext:
Sark will reopen its borders to people from Guernsey, Alderney and Herm from 1 June.
The island said it would allow residents to travel within the bailiwick as Covid-19 was "brought under control".
Residents from outside the bailiwick - including Jersey, France and the UK - will not be allowed to visit for the time being, representatives said on Facebook.
It follows the announcement that Guernsey will enter phase four of its lockdown exit from 30 May, permitting non-essential travel in and out of the island.
